chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4:03 PM Defendant Carlos Tovar Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie M. Rock in court for Carlos Tovar Jr.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. Victim's mother on conference line.
State regarding other acts, DA Urmanski reached an agreement with Attorney Rock on first video and will work on redacting video. Attorney Rock request she be able to see video after it's done being edited. 
The second video- Defense objects to video being allowed in. Parties make their arguments. 
Defense addresses polygraph, feels it is admissible. Court agrees- deft may choose to testify to the polygraph.
Court addresses motion in limine. 
State requesting court order the rack belt- Defense objects. Court orders a rack belt. 
Jury trial to start at 8:30- will carry 2 alternates. Court okay with jurors taking notes.
Amended

State in compliance with victim rights/marsy's law. 
Motion to admit recording statements of victim, motion re; polygraph, and motions in limine to be taken up tomorrow. State is meeting with victim tomorrow. 
Court needs written jury instructions from parties.
